alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 3:06AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, Fairfield. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM EDT, Doppler Radar indicated heavy rain fell in the advisory area within the last two hours. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. There are areas of residual flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stamford, Norwalk, New Canaan, Fairfield, Greenwich, Westport and Darien. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
